unnormalised: Okay, here's a draft Quora post on "Urban Gym Culture" in the "Lifestyle & Wellness" category:
normalised: Okay, here's the normalized version of your Quora post, following all the specified rules:

unnormalised: **What's the urban gym culture like in Indian cities these days?**
normalised: What's the urban gym culture like in Indian cities these days?

unnormalised: So, I've been hitting the gym pretty regularly in Mumbai for the past year, and it's wild how much things have changed! Forget those dingy old "akhadas" of our grandfathers – we're talking sleek, air-conditioned spaces with protein shakes and personal trainers named Rohan and Priya.
normalised: So, I've been hitting the gym pretty regularly in Mumbai for the past year, and it's wild how much things have changed! Forget those dingy old "akhadas" of our grandfathers – we're talking sleek, air-conditioned spaces with protein shakes and personal trainers named Rohan and Priya.

unnormalised: The vibe is definitely competitive, but also surprisingly supportive. You'll see everyone from college students from IIT Bombay bulking up to busy professionals trying to de-stress after a long day at work. There's this unspoken understanding of shared suffering, I guess!
normalised: The vibe is definitely competitive, but also surprisingly supportive. You'll see everyone from college students from I I T Bombay bulking up to busy professionals trying to de-stress after a long day at work. There's this unspoken understanding of shared suffering, I guess!

unnormalised: And the focus! It's not just about lifting heavy anymore. People are into functional training, HIIT, yoga (which is pretty funny considering its origins!), and even stuff like Zumba. My gym, "Fitness First" in Bandra, is like 5000 sq ft, packed with all sorts of equipment I don't even know how to use!
normalised: And the focus! It's not just about lifting heavy anymore. People are into functional training, H I I T, yoga (which is pretty funny considering its origins!), and even stuff like Zumba. My gym, "Fitness First" in Bandra, is like five thousand square feet, packed with all sorts of equipment I don't even know how to use!

unnormalised: Of course, there's the pressure to look good, thanks to Instagram influencers. Everyone's documenting their progress with perfectly filtered gym selfies. But honestly, I think it's pushing people to be more disciplined too.
normalised: Of course, there's the pressure to look good, thanks to Instagram influencers. Everyone's documenting their progress with perfectly filtered gym selfies. But honestly, I think it's pushing people to be more disciplined too.

unnormalised: The supplements market is BOOMING. Everyone's chugging protein shakes and pre-workouts. I saw Dr. Sharma recommending creatine to a patient the other day! My only concern is the cost. Gym memberships can be quite expensive, running into several thousand Rs. per month. Plus, add in the supplements and the trendy gym wear...ouch!
normalised: The supplements market is booming. Everyone's chugging protein shakes and pre-workouts. I saw Doctor Sharma recommending creatine to a patient the other day! My only concern is the cost. Gym memberships can be quite expensive, running into several thousand rupees per month. Plus, add in the supplements and the trendy gym wear...ouch!

unnormalised: Has anyone else noticed this change in gym culture? What are your experiences? Do you think it's a positive trend overall? Let's discuss! Maybe suggest some affordable protein options too, please! Because this Mumbai lifestyle isn't cheap!
normalised: Has anyone else noticed this change in gym culture? What are your experiences? Do you think it's a positive trend overall? Let's discuss! Maybe suggest some affordable protein options too, please! Because this Mumbai lifestyle isn't cheap!
